poem:
Title: The Plight of al-Shifa

In the midst of modern Babel,
they sit, 107 and 30.
A pebble of people,
cradled in the bruised palm
of al-Shifa.

Beyond the mortar's reach,
discussions radiate in Cairo,
words slipped into the ether -
ineffectual as prayers.

200 lie silent,
subtracted by the calculus of war,
their voices etched into Gaza's skin,
a narrative punctuated by desperate pauses.
